Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: the best way to make a small fortune in the mining business is to start with a large one

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: FPGAs are older than most people that are now interested in cryptocoins, and people have been using them on Bitcoin since 2010/2011

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: ArtForz, a name you should really know, wrote one of the first GPU miners for BTC

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: `On December 15, 2010 ArtForz noted on IRC that he had 15.75 Ghash/s which at the current difficulty of 12252 would generate 1,292 bitcoins per day and this farm still used Radeon 5770s.`

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: let that sink in. No, really.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: As soon as he was bored with GPUs, he switches to FPGAs+ASICs, and nobody every heard from him again.

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: 1300 BTC per *day* from GPUs

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: some good history here: https://www.ofnumbers.com/2014/04/20/how-artforz-changed-the-history-of-bitcoin-mining/

Author: Alright#0419
Content: in early 2018 it was possible to make roughly $100/day with a single 1080ti

Author: Alright#0419
Content: @ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢 milked the ever living hell out of it 😄

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: at least half of it is when you *sell* what you mined. Most beginner miners don't get that

Author: Alright#0419
Content: was always confused why he let me cut into his profits

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: they value everything *now* and sell for current worth, counting pennies

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @Alright he must like you

Author: Alright#0419
Content: There will always be little niches like that in crypto. Everyone who is paying attention is making money regardless of bull/bear

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: `milked` is past tense, I still have them all and will be firing GPUs back up this week 😛

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: small mining niches always exist

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: large miners have so much overhead, many opportunities are not available to them

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: well, many do. Very smart miners always minimize overhead and grow smart + slowly

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: otherwise you become a story on the news, like all those WA mining colo startups that failed

Author: ComputerGenie 👴🏼📢#7004
Content: I'm still just a baby miner, all mu stuff still fits in a 20'x20' barn 😛

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I managed to make $50 a day from a HD7950 at the end of 2017 for a good week maybe 2.... That card cost me $100 2 years prior 😮

Content: Thats not bad. Verus Hash that KMD has in it is one super crazy powerful algo on CPU. My test chain here 51% PoS64 with verushash is over 2 billion diffuculty with just 3 CPU cores of a RYZEN 2700X.

Content: about 120s block times though. But I kind of calibrated it to that.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I figure that our chains have 0 block reward so no FPGA miner will mine them. VerusHash solved a huge issue with PoS64 chains, took 4 days to get it working.. but it works mint.
